Class ReservationController

java.lang.Object
controllers.ReservationController
public class ReservationController extends Object
Business logic controller for all reservation-related operations.

This controller handles the complete reservation lifecycle including:

  • Creating advance reservations and walk-in waitlist entries
  • Validating availability and opening hours
  • Table assignment and check-in (receiving tables)
  • Bill generation and payment processing
  • Cancellation and no-show handling
  • Waitlist management and customer notifications
  • Manager reports generation

Key Business Rules:

  • Reservations must be at least 1 hour in advance
  • Reservations cannot be more than 1 month ahead
  • Time slots are in 30-minute intervals
  • Each reservation has a 2-hour (120 min) duration
  • Subscribers receive a 10% discount on bills
Version:
1.0
Author:
Yamen Abu Ahmad
See Also:
  • DBController

    • updateReservation

      public common.dto.Reservation.UpdateReservationResult updateReservation(int reservationId, LocalDateTime newDateTime, int newGuests) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing reservation's date/time and guest count.

      Validates the new time against opening hours and 30-minute slot requirements.

      Parameters:
      reservationId - the reservation ID to update
      newDateTime - the new date and time
      newGuests - the new number of guests
      Returns:
      result indicating success or failure with message
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

    • createGuestReservation

      public common.dto.Reservation.CreateReservationResult createGuestReservation(LocalDateTime dateTime, int guests, String fullName, String phone, String email) throws SQLException
      Creates a reservation for a guest (non-subscriber).

      If the guest already exists (by phone/email), uses existing customer record. Otherwise creates a new guest customer record.

      Parameters:
      dateTime - the requested date and time
      guests - number of guests
      fullName - guest's full name
      phone - guest's phone number
      email - guest's email address
      Returns:
      result with reservation ID and confirmation code, or failure
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

    • createReservation

      public common.dto.Reservation.CreateReservationResult createReservation(int customerId, LocalDateTime start, int guests) throws SQLException
      Creates a reservation for an existing customer (subscriber or guest).

      Validates the request against business rules and checks availability. If no space is available, returns suggested alternative times.

      Parameters:
      customerId - the customer ID
      start - the requested date and time
      guests - number of guests
      Returns:
      result with reservation ID and confirmation code, or failure with suggestions
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

      Parameters:

    • joinWaitlist

      public common.dto.Reservation.CreateReservationResult joinWaitlist(Integer subscriberId, int numberOfGuests) throws SQLException
      Adds a subscriber to the waitlist.

      If a table is immediately available, creates a NOTIFIED reservation instead (GO_NOW flow). Otherwise creates a WAITING entry.

      Parameters:
      subscriberId - the subscriber's customer ID
      numberOfGuests - number of guests
      Returns:
      result with reservation ID and confirmation code
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

    • receiveTable

      public common.dto.Reservation.ReceiveTableResult receiveTable(int reservationId) throws SQLException
      Processes table receiving (check-in) for a reservation.

      For NOTIFIED reservations, keeps the pre-assigned table. For ACTIVE reservations, assigns an available table now. Updates status to IN_PROGRESS and records check-in time.

      Parameters:
      reservationId - the reservation ID
      Returns:
      result with assigned table number, or failure
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

    • computeBill

      public common.entity.Bill computeBill(common.entity.Reservation reservation) throws SQLException
      Computes and creates a bill for a reservation.

      Subscribers receive a 10% discount on the final amount.

      Parameters:
      reservation - the reservation to bill
      Returns:
      the created bill entity
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

    • payBillbyId

      public common.dto.Reservation.PayBillResult payBillbyId(int billId) throws SQLException
      Processes bill payment.

      Marks the bill as paid, updates reservation to COMPLETED status, and returns the freed table capacity.

      Parameters:
      billId - the bill ID to pay
      Returns:
      result with final amount and freed capacity, or failure
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

    • revalidateFutureActiveReservations

      public List<Integer> revalidateFutureActiveReservations(LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) throws SQLException
      Re-validates future reservations after capacity changes.

      Moves reservations to WAITING status if they can no longer be accommodated.

      Parameters:
      from - start of the time range to check
      to - end of the time range to check
      Returns:
      list of reservation IDs moved to waiting
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails
